data.question: What is the yield of TANC when synthesized as described?
What is the conductivity of crystal 1 along the a axis at 300 K?
What happens to the conductivity of crystal 1 when the temperature drops to 10 K?
data.answer: It sinks rapidly to 10-6 S cm-1

data.question: What is the ratio of 2,2â€™-bibenzimidazole to 5,11-dihydro-5,6,11,12-tetraazanaphthacene (FFV) in the mixture obtained from the thermal condensation?
What is the role of the spatially disordered F- ions in the electron-transport behavior of crystal 1?
data.answer: They play an important role in the electron-transport behavior.

data.question: Is TANC a stronger electron acceptor than TCNQ and DCNQI?
Does the conductivity of crystal 1 behave as a semiconductor at ambient pressure?
Is the resistivity of crystal 1 at high pressure always decreasing?
Does the Cu 3d orbital contribute significantly to the interchain interaction in crystal 1?
Are the Cu+ ions contributing to the conduction band in crystal 1?
Does the pressure application increase the one-dimensionality and the strength of the random potential due to disordered F- ions in crystal 1?
Is the decrease in resistivity above 6.5 GPa attributed to the enhanced overlap of p orbitals in TANC molecules?
What is the composition of the high-conductivity crystal 1?
What method was used for direct electron-conductivity measurements of crystal 1?
What is the effect of temperature on the resistivity of crystal 1?
data.answer: The resistivity increases uniformly until approximately 6.5 GPa, then decreases slightly at 8 GPa.

data.question: What is the significance of the Cu+ ions in the structure of crystal 1?
data.answer: They are involved in the coordination structure but do not contribute significantly to the interchain interaction.

data.question: How does the structure of crystal 1 contribute to its conductivity?
data.answer: The segregated stacks for each fragment of Cu+ ions and TANC along the a axis form 2D stacking layers, facilitating conductivity.

data.question: What is the role of non-stoichiometric F- ions in crystal 1?
data.answer: They are generated by the dissociation of BF4- anions in the reaction mixture and are located in the spaces between the layers.

data.question: Does the crystal structure of 1 change significantly under high pressure?
data.answer: The text does not provide specific details on structural changes under high pressure, only the resistivity behavior.

data.question: Can TANC be employed as an organic semiconductor with n-type characteristics?
